info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lamoille, central Caledonia, southern Orleans and northeastern Washington Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Calais, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montpelier, St. Johnsbury, Lyndon, Calais, Plainfield, Stannard, Hardwick, Waterbury Village, East Montpelier, Marshfield Village, Worcester, Middlesex, Marshfield, Cabot Village, Woodbury, Cabot, Wheelock, Barre City, E F Knapp State Airport and Peacham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 49 and 61. Interstate 91 between mile markers 126 and 132. Interstate 93 between mile markers 10 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
